headline: Easy Air Fryer Pork Chops
description: These air fryer pork chops have a crispy Parmesan crust, but are super tender and juicy inside — a great option for a quick and delicious dinner.

video.description: In this video, learn how to use your trusty air fryer to make the best (and easiest) pork chops of your life. Trust us — once you try this air fryer pork chop recipe, you'll never go back to your old method again.
video.name: How to Make Easy Air-Fryer Pork Chops

name: Easy Air Fryer Pork Chops

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the air fryer to 380 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Combine Parmesan cheese, paprika, garlic powder, salt, parsley, and pepper in a flat shallow dish; mix well.
Coat each pork chop with olive oil. Dredge both sides of each chop in the Parmesan mixture and set on a plate.
Place 2 chops in the basket of the air fryer and cook for 10 minutes; flipping halfway through cook time. Transfer to a cutting board and let rest for 5 minutes. Repeat with remaining chops.

review.reviewBody: This was so easy but so good. I didn't have enough turkey cutlets that I ended up cutting them in half to stretch this. Family wants me to cook this again tomorrow night
Delicious and easy recipe! My husband loves them! Thank you!

I used those big Costco boneless pork chops. I had to cut them in half as they were so thick. I used Parm cheese and Montreal Steak Seasoning mixed together. I upped the temp to 385 as I had 4 pieces of pork in my air fryer. 6 minutes on each side, and I did a final cook at 400 for 3 minutes to brown the top. It was perfectly cooked and the husband raved about it!
Awesome flavor! Kids loved it, I left out the parmesan though
Delicious. Needed more of the time and more of the mixture to do 3 pork chops. 2 went plain.

I did add 1/4 C of bread crumbs to the cheese and spice mixture. I just used what I had on hand. I think I used the end of plain panko style and what I had left of Italian bread crumbs. Everything else I did as directed and they turned out wonderfully!🤎
This recipe is delicious and family approved. Did not change anything. Good just as written.
Just wondering what we were having for lunch and tried this recipe - Wow! Flavor deluxe, easy, fast & delicious!!
I also added a little Panko and we were all impressed with how this new recipe came out! All the measurement were perfect to coat 4 boneless chops. Crispy and delicious!y
It turned out great very juicy
My pork chops came out so tender and juicy. I followed another reviewer's idea of adding Italian breadcrumbs. Awesome. Unless I grill them, this is the only way I will prepare pork chops.
I used Italian breadcrumbs. It took 6-7 minutes per side instead of 5. Delicious!
Nice flavor, maybe a tad salty. Chops were cooked perfectly. Enjoyed this, thank you!

I made it with just a few changes. I only had garlic/parsley on hand so I used it and cut back on the salt. Had about an inch and half pork chops so I cooked for 20 minutes turning them halfway through came out perfect. Just like the picture
Omg this recipe rocks! Did a little bit more on spice but this was to my preference cooked to recommendation and it was spot on.
Easy and delicious. Pork chops came out nice and tender and juicy.

Hubby and I loved it. Flavorful and moist. Since I preseason my chops before freezing, I used a little less of those seasonings in the dredging mix. Cooking for only two so cut the amounts in half. Don't have a air fryer so used my toaster convection oven and because our chops were considerably larger added some time and upped temp to 400 as someone suggested. This will be our go to when we can't grill! Thank you!
Cooked 1 inch pork chops for 15 min at 390
I shortened the time as I only had 2 chops. They came out good!
Delicious. I made these as written. They were juicy and yummy. Hit a couple peppery places though. Had a lot of the parm cheese spice mixture left over. Next time, I’ll reduce amounts.
Very tasty and moist. Very quick to make too! Gotta love that. Thank you for sharing your recipe.

My husband says these are the best pork chops he has had in a long time…and I agree. The seasoning was perfect. I substituted smoked paprika for the paprika. This is delicious. The meat was tender and yet crispy on the outside.

Best air fried pork chops I’ve made! So juicy and tender. I will use half the salt next time - but that’s a personal preference. These are delicious! I had two large bone in pork chops, so I increased time by 2 minutes. Also bumped temp to 400 after I flipped them. The seasoning recipe makes this amazing!
had thicker chops so cooked longer , everyone loved these!!! really good flavor and so moist!!!

I don’t tend to measure on rubs so more of what I like parm, paprika garlic , didn’t have parsley used Italian herbs, 1 thick chop feeds husband & me. Air fried approx 12 minutes let it rest. Juicy & delish❤️ saving❤️❤️

Just made this as our first air fryer recipe. The reviews were off the charts! Even my picky eater loved it. The only modification we made was using 1/2 the amount of paprika, because ours is from the international grocer and really spicy. PHENOMENAL! We were blown away by how juicy they were. And so easy too. Will make again, thank you so much for the recipe.
I used 1 teaspoon of lemon pepper instead of the 1/2 teaspoon of pepper. It made it a 4 star to a five star recipe. Give it a try! You will love it even more!!!
I used boneless, thick pork chops. They were perfect. Will be having these again real soon!
Made these tonight and they turned out excellent. Moist, tender and very tasty. I cooked for 4 minutes on each side at 380 degrees because my chops were pretty thin.
It was amazing. I did a bone in pork chop. 400° and 6 minutes per side. Preheated, of course.
Easy and Delish!
Great tasting and easy recipe to throw together quickly. Thanks for sharing!
This recipe is so simple and fast. AND, it's absolutely delicious!!
First time cooking pork chops in an air fryer. This recipe is delicious and so easy. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

I saw your recipe earlier today and thought I would make it. Well, I had pork chops out for dinner so I decided to try this recipe. My husband thought they were delicious! He wants me to put it in my rotation for dinner. Thank you the chops were truly great! Lynne

Omg! Used my Ninja and followed the recipe as written. I have never prepared pork chops that I was satisfied with and I’ve been cooking dinners for over 50 years. Always too dry and tough. These were soooo good and hubby in total agreement. Served with mashed potatoes with mushroom gravy and green beans with garden fresh cherry tomatoes. I will definitely save this recipe into my rotation.
It was fabulous soooo juicy and tasty
Loved these chops.
So very easy to put together, air fried very quickly. Was delicious just as the recipe was written

This is my go-to recipe for air fryer chops. I use bone-in chops and they always turn out absolutely perfect. I prefer bone-in as they tend to be a bit juicier than boneless. I was never a big fan of pork chops until I found this recipe. Now, we have them about once a week.
always yummy and tender
I added about 1/4 cup of Panko bread crumbs but other than that followed the recipe. It turned out beautifully! Thanks for shar8ng!
Absolutely wonderful!!
Didn't crust as well as I would have liked, but very delicious and will be made again.
I made this exactly according to the recipe. It was excellent ……moist, tender and delicious. I’ll definitely make it again.
Very good, I used sesame oil instead of olive.

Tasted great but mine didn't brown as much as the. Picture. I cooked 4 in my Pampered Chef Air Fryer on 400° for 15 minutes and flipped them once in the middle. They were perfectly cooked I sidde and had started to brown on the edges just not all over. I also should add I used the "air fry" setting on it versus any of the other settings! Maybe I should have used one of the others??

I used smoked paprika and roasted garlic powder. I cooked it for 13 minutes since I’ve found that I either need more time or more heat on every recipe ( Instant Pot Air Fryer). I’m going to cut the salt in half next time but outside of that this was a huge hit.

I’d pretty much stopped buying pork chops because I couldn’t seem to cook them without drying them out. Not anymore! These turned out great! Very juicy and tender and a complete snap to make. I am so happy to have found this recipe!
Easy, quick and so good!!! Will be making these again! The chops were nice and juicy with a lot of flavor! I even sent the recipe to friends because I thought it was great!
Loved it. Added some panko crumbs to the coating.
Quick and easy, slight change to cooking time, I added 5 minutes and cooked at 360 degrees.
Very tasty, I did not alter the recipe. I might add Chipotle next time
Easy and delicious! I followed the recipe exactly as written (except for the dried parsley). Great for a quick weeknight meal. I will definitely make this again!

These got really amazing! The chops were so juicy! The chops I bought were small and thin and the time/temp were spot on. (I'd obviously adjust if using bigger/thicker ones.) Someone else suggested doubling the seasonings and throwing in some panko crumbs so I did. Great flavor 👍

Delicious!! I sprayed with olive oil. I added some Italian breadcrumbs with the Parmesan. I cooked 4 minutes on one side and 6 on the other. They were extremely juicy. Next time, I may do the whole 6 minutes each side. Otherwise, it’s perfect!
Good just as is
This is a yummy fast way to cook boneless pork chops. I didn't have shredded parmesan, so I used grated parmesan cheese. My family raved about, so I will make it again & again.
I followed the recipe exactly. Came out perfect! Kids all ate seconds. I use my Instant Vortex Plus on airfry setting..
Excellent flavor. Moist. I also tried using same spices and coated with panko. Also delicious.
Actually, really good. I would cut down the salt a little but other than that, it was perfect. Watch temperature I cooked my 11 minutes at 375 degrees to 145 internal temp.
we absolutely loved this recipe. we have made this 2 times already their is nothing ever left it is so good!!!!
OMG this is amazing and easy. Yes it's a keeper. I may just do this from now on. YUMMY 😋

Once the pork chops are defrosted and pat dry with a paper towel brush the meat with the olive oil on the top place them two at a time in a plastic Tupperware box topside down in the mixed ingredients then brush the second side and shake until fully coated evenly. Airfry about 15 minutes then flip over and cook about 15 more minutes mine turned out excellent.
it was very easy to make, and my family loved it! I definitely will be making this again !
Delicious! I used 1” thick boneless pork chops and air fried for 17 minutes. They came out golden brown with a perfect crust. Will definitely make again.
Best chops I’ve ever eaten in my life!!!
Very good. Didn’t have paprika.
great instructions. Very juicy & flavourable thank you

I made it tonight In The air fryer. They were really good. I added about 1/4 tsp more of paprika. I used smoked paprika. I would reduce the kosher salt by just a little bit next time. I don’t use salt when I cook so it was slightly saltier than I’m use to but not bad at all. My husband enjoyed it very much. We had it with roasted red skin potatoes and onions and whole sautéed green beans. The cheese gets the air fryer a little messy so be prepared to clean the basket in between portions. Overall, good recipe and I would cook it again with just some very minor tweaks.

So, this is my first review and I have tried 100's of recipes from this site. Yes, I need to review more because I have loved many! This is by far my favorite pork chop recipe I have ever made. I had almost given up on making pork chops because I always felt they are too dry and really not that flavorful no matter how I make them. This, however, was to moist and so much flavor. It was up there with a really good steak. I made it just as is, maybe I made a tad bit more of the mixture to make sure the pork chops were fully covered. I also did use "pork ribeye" cut. I did not know the difference between that cut and center cut but the butcher said the the ribeye cut of the pork is supposed to be more tender. I will be making this at least once a month if not more. Thank you for the recipe and I highly recommend it.

I cut this recipe in half for 2 chops and I only cooked them 8 minutes because they were small and thin, they were cooked to perfection. I didn't make any other changes to it. The flavor was excellent, I will be making this a regular. Thank you
Delicious…crunchy on outside and juicy inside! Loved it!

My wife & kids love this. We use the air fryer 390°f for 6 minutes per side. It is now a main dish we have at least once a week. I add a little more pepper 1/4 tsp but other than that its amazing. Be sure to let it rest for 5 minutes as per the directions.

I liked it very much although with the parmesan and the added salt even with me cutting back half on the salt it was still salty! My wife didn't eat hers. Next time I will totally omit the added salt. In defense of the recipe I am a heart patient and have greatly reduced my sodium to less than 2000mg per day. I will do this again.
Tastes great
I made it like it is and it was delicious. Served it with asparagus and sweet potatoes.
This recipe was very good, quick and easy! I added smoked paprika to add more flavor and a small amount of panko breadcrumbs and it turned out great!
Great recipe! I have made it several times. I even love eating the leftovers cold. It's also a quick and easy meal after work. It's definitely a keeper!
Super easy, delicious and made with items that I have in my pantry. My husband and grandson LOVED these chops!
First time doing chops in a air fryer I bought my wife Doubled the recipe using a ninja dual zone air fryer
Made this tonight for something different. Really loved the taste and the juiciness of the chop. Excellent recipe. Only thing I did differently was cooked 12 minutes instead of 10.
This recipe was super delicious. The whole family loved these. Will definitely make again.

I did make a big change, unintentionally, I used peameal bacon instead of pork chops. I omitted the salt due the saltiness of the meat. It was tender and moist. I’ll make it again but with the suggested porc.

My husband absolutely loves these pork chops and requests them often. I use 3/4-1” boneless chops and up the air fry time to about 6 minutes per side. I’ve overcooked the heck out of many a pork chop in my time, but these are perfect every time. Thanks for the post!
Sooooo good, I doubled the cheese and the spices and it was perfect! Thanks so much for the recipe

Fabulous. Rinsed and patted dry six thin cut pork chops. One at a time, lightly spritzed both sides with avocado oil and coated them "shake n bake style" in a gallon zip-loc bag. Cooked all six at once as my air fryer is large enough. Six minutes per side and let rest a couple of minutes. Will definitely make again!
Delicious and oh so easy. First time using air fryer. Next time going to cook for 10 minutes, not 12 (my mistake).
It was quick and easy with little cleanup. I used fresh garlic and fresh parsley because I do not keep the powdered versions and it was perfect.

The chops were quite tasty and juicy and were a hit with me and the kids. I will be making again, although next time I would go a little lighter on the salt. The cheese is salty and the extra salt can be toned down. Also, I had to cook for 15 minutes.
Incredibly tasty but what surprised me the most was the juiciness of the pork chops. I will make this again for sure. The only adjustment I would make is to reduce the salt to 1/2 tsp.

I made this using bone-in pork chops, had to give them more time because they were nice and thick. I monitored their temp using a probe thermometer. They came out excellent, nice and juicy! My side was fried garlic, mushrooms and spinach... very good!

I want to say this recipe is a winner!
I used bone in pork chops because it is what we had in freezer. I did add 1 teaspoon of Smokehouse Maple Seasoning to the ingredients.
I cooked 2 bone in pork chops which were 1/2 to 3/4 inch for 10 min turning half way . Absolutely Delicious!! 
I will definitely make this recipe again.

Scrumptious! Thanks =)
Prayers & Blessings, Harvest.org
Very delicious ?? Nice and juicy

I was nervous at the part cooking with air fryer, first time. I changed my cheese to parmesan grated and cheddar. But meal was good.
thanks for the meal recipe
This is the first recipe I ever tried in my air fryer. So glad it was. Delicious!!!
Very tasty! Thinking of reducing the salt a bit.
Loved this recipe; didn’t add olive oil and still came out very good and juicy.
